meaningMnemonic: The <radical>landslide</radical> <radical>measurement</radical> <kanji>humiliate</kanji>s you. You told everyone you couldn't come to work, that your house had been destroyed and your car was carried away, but then scientists measured the landslide, and it only went a few feet.
readingMnemonic: Your friends and coworkers <kanji>humiliate</kanji> you more by making <reading>joke</reading>s (じょく). "Uh oh, I heard it might rain later, I hope you don't drown in the inch of water that's coming!"
